content.text:
# San Francisco Bay Area Film Critics Circle Awards 2021

20th SFBAFCC Awards
January 10, 2022
----
Best Picture:
The Power of the Dog
----
Best Animated Feature:
Encanto
----
Best Documentary Feature:
Summer of Soul (...Or, When the Revolution Could Not Be Televised)
----
Best Foreign Language Film:
Drive My Car
The 20th San Francisco Bay Area Film Critics Circle Awards, honoring the best in film for 2021, were given on January 10, 2022. The nominations were announced on January 7, 2022, with The Power of the Dog leading the nominations with nine. The film also received the most awards, with eight wins, including Best Picture.
Winners and nominees
, Best Director and Best Adapted Screenplay winner]]
, Best Actor winner]]
, Best Actress winner]]
, Best Supporting Actor winner]]
, Best Supporting Actress winner]]
These are the nominees for the 20th SFFCC Awards. Winners are listed at the top of each list:
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Picture
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Director
|-
| valign="top" |
* The Power of the Dog
** Drive My Car
** The Green Knight
** Licorice Pizza
** West Side Story
| valign="top" |
* 'Jane Campion – The Power of the Dog'
** Maggie Gyllenhaal – The Lost Daughter
** Ryusuke Hamaguchi – Drive My Car
** Steven Spielberg – West Side Story
** Denis Villeneuve – Dune
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Actor
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Benedict Cumberbatch – The Power of the Dog as Phil Burbank'
** Nicolas Cage – Pig as Robin "Rob" Feld
** Andrew Garfield – tick, tick... BOOM! as Jonathan Larson
** Hidetoshi Nishijima – Drive My Car as Yūsuke Kafuku
** Will Smith – King Richard as Richard Williams
** Denzel Washington – The Tragedy of Macbeth as Lord Macbeth
| valign="top" |
* 'Olivia Colman – The Lost Daughter as Leda Caruso'
** Jessica Chastain – The Eyes of Tammy Faye as Tammy Faye Bakker
** Penélope Cruz – Parallel Mothers as Janis Martinez
** Kristen Stewart – Spencer as Diana, Princess of Wales
** Tessa Thompson – Passing as Irene "Reenie" Redfield
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Supporting Actor
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Supporting Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Kodi Smit-McPhee – The Power of the Dog as Peter Gordon'
** Bradley Cooper – Licorice Pizza as Jon Peters
** Ciarán Hinds – Belfast as Pop
** Troy Kotsur – CODA as Frank Rossi
** J. K. Simmons – Being the Ricardos as William Frawley
| valign="top" |
* 'Kirsten Dunst – The Power of the Dog as Rose Gordon'
** Jessie Buckley – The Lost Daughter as Young Leda Caruso
** Ariana DeBose – West Side Story as Anita
** Marlee Matlin – CODA as Jackie Rossi
** Ruth Negga – Passing as Clare Bellew
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Adapted Screenplay
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Original Screenplay
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Jane Campion – The Power of the Dog'
** Maggie Gyllenhaal – The Lost Daughter
** Rebecca Hall – Passing
** Ryusuke Hamaguchi and Takamasa Oe – Drive My Car
** Eric Roth, Jon Spaihts, and Denis Villeneuve – Dune
| valign="top" |
* 'Mike Mills – C'mon C'mon'
** Paul Thomas Anderson – Licorice Pizza
** Kenneth Branagh – Belfast
** Adam McKay and David Sirota – ''Don't Look Up
** Aaron Sorkin – Being the Ricardos
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Animated Feature
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Documentary Feature
|-
| valign="top" |
* Encanto
** Belle
** Flee (Honorable Mention)
** Luca
** The Mitchells vs. the Machines
| valign="top" |
* Summer of Soul (...Or, When the Revolution Could Not Be Televised)
** Flee
** Procession
** The Rescue
** The Velvet Underground
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Foreign Language Film
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Cinematography

** Parallel Mothers
** The Worst Person in the World
| valign="top" |
* 'Bruno Delbonnel – The Tragedy of Macbeth'
** Greig Fraser – Dune
** Janusz Kamiński – West Side Story
** Dan Laustsen – Nightmare Alley
** Andrew Droz Palermo – The Green Knight
** Ari Wegner – The Power of the Dog
** Robert Yeoman – The French Dispatch
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%"| Best Film Editing

** Joe Walker – Dune

** Daniel Hart – The Green Knight

! style="background:#EEDD82; width:50%" colspan="2"| Best Production Design
